tags: sandor deserves a pov and love
Tyrion is actually a terrible person
are we supposed to ignore the book characterization?
summary: Kind of annoyed, saw one of those GoT promos and during the overview of Sansa Stark’s story; not one word about Sandor Clegane...
body:
Kind of annoyed, saw one of those GoT promos and during the overview of Sansa Stark’s story; not one word about Sandor Clegane was spoken, but sure heard a lot about Tyrion Lannister…ugh. There’s been a lot in the series that has irritated me, but if I see an iota of Sansa x Tyrion shoved in my face, I’ ll be sick. 

[on a side note: Tyrion has had love in his life, once in the books and twice in the show. Sadly that was taken from him, but he’s known love however brief, unlike Sandor Clegane who hasn’t had an ounce of love tossed at him… so that’s just where I stand.]

summary: They say the Ice Queen is kissed by fire. That her hair is like flames, and that she has a warm smile. But her eyes count a...
body: They say the Ice Queen is kissed by fire. That her hair is like flames, and that she has a warm smile. But her eyes count a different story. They’re like ice, like wildness in her veins. She is the queen they go to war for. // text by @littlecatxd666

summary: The Starks will be unstoppable in season 8.
title: The Starks will be unstoppable in season 8.
body:
The show started out rough for the Stark’s but season 8 will be their season. We have the magical three-eyed raven, a skilled master assassin, a potential young queen who is kind and fast becoming a master of the Game and Jon Snow a skilled warrior who just so happens to be the heir to the Iron Throne. They have the allegiance of the North and Vale and loyal support from from the likes of Sam, Brienne and soon Jaime. It’s true that anything could happen, but House of Stark has been through a lot and are likely to come out stronger than ever this final season.

I am sooo excited you guys and can not wait !!!!

blog.name: andthemaidenfair
blog.title: By The Old Gods and The New

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Honestly I read Sansa and Arya’s relationship as more of an average sibling rivalry than anything else. I’ve seen a lot of...
body:
Honestly I read Sansa and Arya’s relationship as more of an average sibling rivalry than anything else. I’ve seen a lot of people claim that the sisters hated each other and made each other miserable but I just don’t see that in the books.

TLDR: Sometimes a sibling rivalry is just a sibling rivalry.

My brother and I were close in age and bickered and fought constantly as kids. We’d get all worked up and say mean things or “tattle” or shove each other and it would be a whole thing. My brother and I weren’t pitted against each other by our family, friends, or teachers. But we still argued regularly. We still developed a competitive relationship that lasted throughout our childhoods. 

But we grew out of it. Around the time I was 16 my brother quite suddenly became my friend, ally, and confidant. We had developed the maturity needed to use our words and take a minute to consider that the other might not be trying to upset us, or to just walk away sometimes. We also began to understand that  the nasty things we said and did to each other did matter. It wasn’t until I was 17 that I realized that what I’d thought was joke teasing had actually hurt him. I didn’t even think I had the ability to hurt his feelings. And he had the same realization about me. Regardless of our petty fights we never hated each other. In fact when we weren’t squabbling together we were playing together. 

 I’ve never had a sister and I don’t live in the asoiaf misogynistic society that so openly and structurally calculates ones worth on gender based accomplishments so it’s not quite the same situation. But I do see a lot of my own sibling relationship in Arya and Sansa. One based on mutual immaturity rather than mutual hatred. 

I do think that it would have been more difficult than just suddenly growing out of their antagonistic relationship if The Plot not happened. The world they live in supports Sansa’s view of Arya as an embarrassing wild child and one of them might have still been sent away as a ward or bride before they could work things out. I don’t think they would ever truly see eye to eye but I do think that they could have grown and matured enough to love and support one another. Or to at least be on friendly terms.
body_abstract:
Honestly I read Sansa and Arya’s relationship as more of an average sibling rivalry than anything else. I’ve seen a lot of people claim that the sisters hated each other and made each other miserable but I just don’t see that in the books.

TLDR: Sometimes a sibling rivalry is just a sibling rivalry.

tags: i need so much griff x alayne
summary: For the prompts thing - 1 for aegonsa
question: For the prompts thing - 1 for aegonsa
answer:
Things you said at 1am

-

It would be easy to blame it on the booze, but he knows that’s not what makes him say it. “My name isn’t Griff. It’s Aegon.”

“Griff?” Alayne pauses, confusion clear upon her face, and that only surprises him a little. He thought she knew, he thought they each understood the other to be a liar. But he is tired of the lies, and the dyes, and hells, he thinks he might be on the edge of in love with this girl, but he knows he can’t cross that line as Griff. It’s time.

“Alayne…” Aegon knows that’s not her real name, but he doesn’t know what else to call her. He hoped that someday, soon, she would trust him enough to share her secrets, but he wouldn’t ask it of her, just as she hadn’t asked it of him. He could wait until she was ready. He was ready now though, whatever the fallout.

“I’m Aegon Targaryen.”

-

Send me a ship and a number

tags: time for the monthly jon snow dragging
summary: Reading your answers about jon snowflake I just wish him to be dead in s8 more. Sansa was made so subservient in order to this...
question: Reading your answers about jon snowflake I just wish him to be dead in s8 more. Sansa was made so subservient in order to this westerosi golden boy. And I don't hesitate that her future role will keep kissing jon's  magical ass and keep HER crown on his stupid head. So I just hope in the he'll fuck off to dragonstone or KL
answer: I want him gone. I can already see her last scene being all ‘you’re the best Aegon!’ and if that happens I will fight D&D, the whole HBO and possibly the actors. We didn’t see Sansa struggle for seasons only to become someone’s cheerleader.

reblog.comment: I want him gone. I can already see her last scene being all ‘you’re the best Aegon!’ and if that happens I will fight D&D, the whole HBO and possibly the actors. We didn’t see Sansa struggle for seasons only to become someone’s cheerleader.

blog.name: ladystarks
blog.title: lo, the transforming power of love

question: Sansa x jeyne 9
answer:
9) things you said when I was crying

“Shh,” Sansa murmurs into Jeyne’s hair. “Ramsay will never hurt you again. No one will. I won’t allow it.”

Over Jeyne’s head, Sansa can see the maester beckoning, his face spelling out that there is no time for this. Her council is waiting. She ignores him, simply holds her friend. 

“I’m right here,” Sansa tells her over and over, until Jeyne calms. “I’m not going anywhere.”

summary: EW's 'Game of Thrones' podcast returns for a season 8 preview
body:
EW’s ‘Game of Thrones’ podcast returns for a season 8 preview

Worth a listen! Interesting notes related to Sansa:

- Sophie Turner was the first cast member to finish the scripts and respond to D and D

- Darren guessed that Sansa would end up on the throne

- James joked about Gendry being on the throne, which I’m taking to mean it’s not happening

reblog.comment:

Season 8 will be end of an awesome journey for them. So excited. It’ll be great!

tags: and for you to know I always called him “txutxo” which comes from “chucho” which means dog in spanish but that’s another story
title: giggles
body:
My boyfriend and I are rewatching Game of Thrones…

We are in the second season.

He knows I ship Sansan.

When Sandor saves Sansa form the mob, he asked me what did he call her. I said “little bird”. He giggled.

Whenever we have a Sansan scene I say the word “little bird”, and he giggles.

I even started to call him “little bird” because he giggles!

Whenever any character says something like: “I would kill for you” or “I would die for you”  and I say “Don’t say it! Do it!! Do it like Sandor, who killed some men in order to save Sansa without saying anything to her and not doing it for anyone but her!”,  my boyfriend giggles.

Whenever Sansa says something clever or sassy or I say something in her defence, he giggles!

What I want to say is that I think we might have another Sansan shipper… and that I am very proud that he’s starting to appreciate Sansa for what she is.

That’s all.

summary: I hated Sansa having to coddle Jon when she was just trying to give him advice. When she told him he was doing a good job at...
question: I hated Sansa having to coddle Jon when she was just trying to give him advice. When she told him he was doing a good job at ruling, I was like that was a damn lie. Sansa has probably ruled for a longer time and done a better job at ruling the North since Jon has been down in Dragonstone being kept as a prisoner. I know that when it's revealed that he's a Targ, Sansa is going to spend a decent chunk of her time defending him and comforting him. I hope she'll get some good focus on her in s8.
answer:
Right???? That scene was basically:

Jon: How dare you question me in front of my men?

Sansa: I just think you need to be careful with your choices. Also you do know Joffrey didn’t like to be questioned?

Jon: Are you saying I’m practically the same as Joffrey?!

Sansa: No! No. I just think you need to listen to people more. *Jon continues to be a brat* I actually think you’re a good king.

Jon: Thanks. Keep your mouth shut next time.

Sansa: Hey I know you’re only interested in the Wight Walkers but you shouldn’t ignore Cersei, she’s very dangerous

Jon: You sound like you flick your clit to Cersei

I love how we get evidence that she’s a better ruler than he is but we can’t allow Jonny boy’s shine to be taken from him so let’s have Arya be an absolute psycho about how power hungry Sansa is despite the fact that Sansa averted a coup against Jon.

Anon I’ve been dreading the use of Sansa as Jon’s therapist. I don’t want her to spend the season lifting his self esteem, let Arya do that. I do hope that there’s enough content to justify what Sophie has been saying in the interviews. I want Sansa growing into her role, I want her meeting people who don’t traumatise her, I want her genuinely happy.

blog.name: shewholovestoread
blog.title: She Who Loves To Read and Watch Movies
blog.description: I am a compulsive reader and I love watching films. Sometime I write about how I feel about a film I've seen or a book I've read...

title: Game of Thrones Season 8 Speculation
body:
I’ve been thinking about this for a while and something struck me. This is in relation to those leaked set images that show Jon kneeling to Cersei Lannister. Most people are assuming that he does this because she kidnaps Sansa and he’s forced to travel south and bend the knee to make sure that Sansa is safe.

However, this assumption throws up some questions, for instance, how did Cersei manage to kidnap Sansa from Winterfell? Sansa is the Lady of Winterfell and currently Queen in the North and furthermore, her people respect and admire her. Add to that, Arya is back at Winterfell, before long Brienne will reach her as well. And even though Jon is travelling with Dany, we know just how much he prizes Sansa’s safety. So when she’s surrounded by so many people who are more than capable of keeping her safe, how will Cersei manage to kidnap her?

I think this is where Tyrion will come into play. We’ve seen him get pushed to the sidelines by Dany now that she’s agreed to help Jon and his cause. We’ve also seen him look less-than-pleased by the turn of events (boatbang) Holding the camera on his expression was a deliberate choice and it lasts too long to not have some significance. Once their convoy reaches Winterfell, we will see Tyrion’s dissatisfaction grow even more. Most GA like Tyrion and ShowTyrion is way more likeable than BookTyrion (for the sake of clarity I will be only be talking about ShowTyrion in this post) Prior to joining Dany, Tyrion had hit rock bottom, he had just killed his father and Shae and was a fugitive on the run.

Tyrion also has a few very key weak spots. One is that he’s scared of being expendable and not being of any consequence, and he likes having power. Now, he’s not power-mad like Cersei and a certain other queen who loves titles, but he does have a taste for it. And despite being unwanted by his father, he’s grown up with power at his disposal. He won’t like that he’s been set aside in favour of someone else, someone he never imagined would come to have so much influence over Dany. And he resents that loss of power.

Tyrion also has a soft-spot for his family and unlike Cersei, he gets blind-sided by it. Cersei hates Tyrion and she embraces it, she makes no bones about it. But it’s not so clear cut for Tyrion. He may have hated Joffrey but he felt genuine affection for Tommen and Myrcella. And now that Cersei is pregnant again, she plays into his weak-spot. We don’t see how their conversation concludes and it was too important to have been just cut-off like that. If we didn’t see it conclude then we can safely assume that it will have some influence on future events.

So, resenting his loss of station and whatever it is that he and Cersei decided will lead him to kidnap Sansa. Also keep in mind, Sansa trusts him, she thinks that he won’t hurt her. But like her, he too has changed and is no longer as noble as he’d like to think. He is the only person I think who could kidnap Sansa and get her out of Winterfell.

Now, onto Jon bending the knee to Cersei in King’s Landing. That too looks like a misdirect. Sansa tells Jon time and again that Jon must make smarter choices. Their father’s honour will not help them in the wars to come and I think we can safely assume that Jon is following that advice (Political!Jon) The other thing she tries to stress is just how dangerous Cersei is and that they can’t afford to underestimate her. I think Jon believes her. When he realises that Sansa has been taken, his first impulse will be to ride south. But that’s precisely what he did when he saw Rickon on the battlefield (Battle of the Bastards) and almost died and lost his entire army. Sansa had told him then as well that they won’t get Rickon back, he ignored her and nearly died. He won’t make that same mistake again.

This is where Brienne and Jaime come in. Jaime has been trying to live a more honourable existence and season 7 finally saw breaking away from the toxic relationship he shares with Cersei. Brienne is sworn to protect Sansa and Jamie will not let her go into King’s Landing alone, considering that he knows that place far better than she does. I think the Hound will play some part in this as well, and this is how he will finally face his brother and kill him once and for all. I have a feeling that Arya will have to stay at Winterfell, they can’t have almost all the Starks so deep in enemy territory.

So while, Jon makes sure that all of Cersei’s attention is focused on him, Jaime, Brienne and the Hound will infiltrate King’s Landing and rescue Sansa.

Realising that Sansa has been taken could also be how Jon finally faces his feelings for her, accepts them for what they are and will act on them when he gets her back.

Tagging @trinuviel, @jonsa101 and @lostlittlesatellites for their inputs.

Update: This is a speculation post, naturally there will be people who will disagree and that’s fine. We’re all entitled to our opinion, I look forward to reading what other people think, that’s why I posted it. But if you can’t be civil about it, stay off my blog and don’t drag your hate here, I will block you. I don’t need to take your shit.

summary: I see the argument that Sansa manipulated Jon into fighting BotB by dangling the idea of saving Rickon in front of him, when she...
question: I see the argument that Sansa manipulated Jon into fighting BotB by dangling the idea of saving Rickon in front of him, when she knew Rickon was not going to survive. What is your interpretation on why Sansa spoke about saving Rickon and later told Jon there was no saving him at all?
answer: This argument would have merit if Sansa wasn’t willing to do it herself. Sansa told Jon that Ramsay had Rickon and that they’ll never be safe as long as Ramsay lived. The closer they got to the battle, the more obvious the military disadvantage became to Sansa so she warned Jon not to fall for Ramsay’s mind games which would certainly involve Rickon as only a good strategy could save them from a crushing defeat. Now the show’s writing is awful so you have to mentally connect dots but it’s very clear how Sansa goes from wanting to rescue Rickon to accepting his death. Also Sansa’s reaction to Rickon had little to do with Jon and everything to do with the writers transforming her into their idea of badass.
